\subsubsection{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}int gfal\_\-access (const char $\ast$ {\em path}, int {\em amode})}\label{group__posix__group_g33d6a4a93117a6c07405aa6ac0d42122}


test access to the given file 

\begin{Desc}
\item[Parameters:]
\begin{description}
\item[{\em path}]path of the file to access, can be in supported protocols (lfn, srm, file, guid,..) \item[{\em amode}]access mode to check (R\_\-OK, W\_\-OK, X\_\-OK or F\_\-OK) \end{description}
\end{Desc}
\begin{Desc}
\item[Returns:]This routine return 0 if the operation was successful, or -1 if error occured and errno is set, call \doxyref{gfal\_\-posix\_\-check\_\-error()}{p.}{gfal__posix__ng_8c_57ced6eae7afd2d0413988da02fe0373} to check it. \par
\begin{itemize}
\item ERRNO list : \par
\begin{itemize}
\item usual errors:\begin{itemize}
\item ENOENT: The named file/directory does not exist.\item EACCES: Search permission is denied on a component of the path prefix or specified access to the file itself is denied.\item EFAULT: path is a NULL pointer.\item ENOTDIR: A component of path prefix is not a directory.\item ECOMM: Communication error\item EPROTONOSUPPORT: Access method not supported.\item EINVAL: path has an invalid syntax or amode is invalid. \end{itemize}
\end{itemize}
\end{itemize}
\end{Desc}
\begin{Desc}
\item[Examples: ]\par
\bf{gfal\_\-testchmod.c}.\end{Desc}

\index{posix_group@{posix\_\-group}!gfal_lseek@{gfal\_\-lseek}}
\index{gfal_lseek@{gfal\_\-lseek}!posix_group@{posix\_\-group}}
\subsubsection{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}off\_\-t gfal\_\-lseek (int {\em fd}, off\_\-t {\em offset}, int {\em whence})}\label{group__posix__group_g8ba4e1df5f2e6439641c56f245d5ce73}


set position in a file gfal\_\-lseek positions/repositions to offset the file associated with the descriptor fd generated by a previous gfal\_\-open. whence indicates how to interpret the offset value: 

SEEK\_\-SET The offset is set from beginning of file.

SEEK\_\-CUR The offset is added to current position.

SEEK\_\-END The offset is added to current file size. \begin{Desc}
\item[Parameters:]
\begin{description}
\item[{\em fd}]: file descriptor to lseek \item[{\em offset,:}]offset in byte \item[{\em whence,:}]flag \end{description}
\end{Desc}
\begin{Desc}
\item[Returns:]This routine returns the actual offset from the beginning of the file if the operation was successful or -1 if the operation failed. In the latter case, errno is set appropriately, you can call \doxyref{gfal\_\-posix\_\-check\_\-error()}{p.}{gfal__posix__ng_8c_57ced6eae7afd2d0413988da02fe0373} for a more complete description. \end{Desc}

\subsubsection{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}int gfal\_\-open (const char $\ast$ {\em path}, int {\em flag}, mode\_\-t {\em mode})}\label{group__posix__group_g6a431a0bdd01baf8cadbdcaa98b1c622}


open a file opens a file according to the value of flags. 

\begin{Desc}
\item[Parameters:]
\begin{description}
\item[{\em path}]: url of the filename to open. can be in supported protocols (lfn, srm, file, guid,..) \item[{\em flag}]: same flag supported value is built by OR\^{a}€™ing the bits defined in $<$fcntl.h$>$ but one and only one of the first three flags below must be used O\_\-RDONLY open for reading only O\_\-WRONLY open for writing only O\_\-RDWR open for reading and writing O\_\-CREAT If the file exists already and O\_\-EXCL is also set, gfal\_\-open will fail O\_\-LARGEFILE allows files whose sizes cannot be represented in 31 bits to be opened \item[{\em mode}]is used only if the file is created. \end{description}
\end{Desc}
\begin{Desc}
\item[Returns:]return the file descriptor or -1 if errno is set call \doxyref{gfal\_\-posix\_\-check\_\-error()}{p.}{gfal__posix__ng_8c_57ced6eae7afd2d0413988da02fe0373} to check it \end{Desc}
\begin{Desc}
\item[Examples: ]\par
\bf{gfal\_\-testread.c}, and \bf{gfal\_\-testrw.c}.\end{Desc}
\index{posix_group@{posix\_\-group}!gfal_opendir@{gfal\_\-opendir}}
\index{gfal_opendir@{gfal\_\-opendir}!posix_group@{posix\_\-group}}
\subsubsection{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}DIR$\ast$ gfal\_\-opendir (const char $\ast$ {\em name})}\label{group__posix__group_g004ad5efbd544da820823e597e57be92}


open a directory 

opens a directory to be used in subsequent gfal\_\-readdir operations the url supported are : local files, surls, plugin url ( lfc,...) \begin{Desc}
\item[Parameters:]
\begin{description}
\item[{\em name}]of the directory to open, can be in supported protocols (lfn, srm, file, guid,..) \end{description}
\end{Desc}
\begin{Desc}
\item[Returns:]file descriptor DIR$\ast$ if success else NULL if error and errno is set call \doxyref{gfal\_\-posix\_\-check\_\-error()}{p.}{gfal__posix__ng_8c_57ced6eae7afd2d0413988da02fe0373} to check it\end{Desc}
\begin{itemize}
\item ERRNO list : \par
\begin{itemize}
\item usual errors:\begin{itemize}
\item ENOENT: The named file/directory does not exist.\item EACCES: Write perimission is denied for path, or, search permission is denied for one of the directories in the path prefix of oldpath or newpath, or oldpath is a directory and does not allow write permission (needed to update the .. entry)\item EFAULT: path is a NULL pointer.\begin{itemize}
\item ENOTEMPTY : newpath is a nonempty directory, that is, contains entries other than \char`\"{}.\char`\"{} and \char`\"{}..\char`\"{}\end{itemize}
\item ENOTDIR: path or a component in path is not a directory\begin{itemize}
\item EMFILE: too many file open by the process\end{itemize}
\item ECOMM: Communication error\item EPROTONOSUPPORT: path has a syntax error or the protocol speficied is not supported\item EINVAL: path has an invalid syntax . \end{itemize}
\end{itemize}
\end{itemize}
\begin{Desc}
\item[Examples: ]\par
\bf{gfal\_\-testdir.c}.\end{Desc}

\subsubsection{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}struct dirent$\ast$ gfal\_\-readdir (DIR $\ast$ {\em d})}\label{group__posix__group_g2a8ed205f7748d7817a18521268a1f2d}


read a directory 

The readdir() function returns a pointer to a dirent structure representing the next directory entry in the directory stream pointed to by dirp. It returns NULL on reaching the end of the directory stream or if an error occurred. struct dirent \{ ino\_\-t d\_\-ino; // inode number off\_\-t d\_\-off; // offset to the next dirent unsigned short d\_\-reclen; // length of this record unsigned char d\_\-type; // type of file; not supported // by all file system types char d\_\-name[256]; // filename \};

\begin{Desc}
\item[Parameters:]
\begin{description}
\item[{\em d}]file handle ( return by opendir ) to read \end{description}
\end{Desc}
\begin{Desc}
\item[Returns:]pointer to struct dirent with file information or NULL if end of list or error, errno is set call \doxyref{gfal\_\-posix\_\-check\_\-error()}{p.}{gfal__posix__ng_8c_57ced6eae7afd2d0413988da02fe0373} to check it \end{Desc}
\begin{Desc}
\item[Warning:]struct dirents are allocated statically, do not use free() on them\end{Desc}
\begin{itemize}
\item ERRNO list : \par
\begin{itemize}
\item usual errors:\begin{itemize}
\item EBADF : bad file descriptor\begin{itemize}
\item ECOMM : Communication error \end{itemize}
\end{itemize}
\end{itemize}
\end{itemize}
\begin{Desc}
\item[Examples: ]\par
\bf{gfal\_\-testdir.c}.\end{Desc}

\subsubsection{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}int gfal\_\-rename (const char $\ast$ {\em oldpath}, const char $\ast$ {\em newpath})}\label{group__posix__group_gc56b24046cef203517f30023a999bf1c}


change the name or location of a file oldpath and newpath need to be on the same plugin this functions work only with plugins (lfc ) and local files 

\begin{Desc}
\item[Parameters:]
\begin{description}
\item[{\em oldpath}]: the old path of the file, can be in supported protocols but need to be in the same adress space than newpath \item[{\em newpath}]: the new path of the file, can be in supported protocols (lfn, srm, file, guid,..) \end{description}
\end{Desc}
\begin{Desc}
\item[Returns:]: return 0 if success, else -1 and errno / \doxyref{gfal\_\-posix\_\-check\_\-error()}{p.}{gfal__posix__ng_8c_57ced6eae7afd2d0413988da02fe0373}\begin{itemize}
\item ERRNO list : \par
\begin{itemize}
\item ENOENT: The named file/directory does not exist.\item EACCES: Write perimission is denied for newpath or oldpath, or, search permission is denied for one of the directories in the path prefix of oldpath or newpath, or oldpath is a directory and does not allow write permission (needed to update the .. entry)\item EFAULT: oldpath or newpath is a NULL pointer\item EISDIR: newpath is an existing directory but oldpath is not a directory\item ENOTEMPTY or EEXIST : newpath is a nonempty directory, that is, contains entries other than \char`\"{}.\char`\"{} and \char`\"{}..\char`\"{}\item ENOTDIR: A component of path prefix is not a directory\item EXDEV oldpath and newpath are not on the same mounted file system\item ECOMM: Communication error\item EPROTONOSUPPORT: oldpath or newpath has a syntax error or the protocol speficied is not supported\item EINVAL: oldpath or newpath has an invalid syntax \end{itemize}
\end{itemize}
\end{Desc}
\begin{Desc}
\item[Examples: ]\par
\bf{gfal\_\-testcreatedir.c}.\end{Desc}

removes a directory if it is empty remove an existing directory, return error if the dir is not empty 

\begin{Desc}
\item[Parameters:]
\begin{description}
\item[{\em path}]specifies the directory name, can be in supported protocols (lfn, srm, file, guid,..) \end{description}
\end{Desc}
\begin{Desc}
\item[Returns:]return 0 is success else -1 and errno is set call \doxyref{gfal\_\-posix\_\-check\_\-error()}{p.}{gfal__posix__ng_8c_57ced6eae7afd2d0413988da02fe0373} to check it\begin{itemize}
\item ERRNO list : \par
\begin{itemize}
\item usual errors:\begin{itemize}
\item ENOENT: The named file/directory does not exist.\item EACCES: Write perimission is denied for path, or, search permission is denied for one of the directories in the path prefix of oldpath or newpath, or oldpath is a directory and does not allow write permission (needed to update the .. entry)\item EFAULT: path is a NULL pointer.\begin{itemize}
\item ENOTEMPTY : path is a nonempty directory, that is, contains entries other than \char`\"{}.\char`\"{} and \char`\"{}..\char`\"{}\end{itemize}
\item ENOTDIR: A component of path prefix is not a directory\item ECOMM: Communication error\item EPROTONOSUPPORT: path has a syntax error or the protocol speficied is not supported\item EINVAL: path has an invalid syntax . \end{itemize}
\end{itemize}
\end{itemize}
\end{Desc}
\begin{Desc}
\item[Examples: ]\par
\bf{gfal\_\-testcreatedir.c}.\end{Desc}

\subsubsection{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}int gfal\_\-stat (const char $\ast$ {\em path}, struct stat $\ast$ {\em buff})}\label{group__posix__group_g1d8c86d522d5dd26ee7ddcd9c6925964}


informations about a file These functions return information about a file. No permissions are required on the file itself, but \^{a}€” in the case of stat() and lstat() \^{a}€” execute (search) permission is required on all of the directories in path that lead to the file. 

\begin{Desc}
\item[Parameters:]
\begin{description}
\item[{\em path}]: path of the file, can be in supported protocols (lfn, srm, file, guid,..) \item[{\em buff}]: pointer to an allocated struct stat \end{description}
\end{Desc}
\begin{Desc}
\item[Returns:]return 0 if success else -1 and errno is set, call \doxyref{gfal\_\-posix\_\-check\_\-error()}{p.}{gfal__posix__ng_8c_57ced6eae7afd2d0413988da02fe0373} to check it\end{Desc}
\begin{itemize}
\item ERRNO list : \par
\begin{itemize}
\item usual errors:\begin{itemize}
\item ENOENT: The named file/directory does not exist.\item EACCES: Write perimission is denied for newpath or oldpath, or, search permission is denied for one of the directories in the path prefix of oldpath or newpath, or oldpath is a directory and does not allow write permission (needed to update the .. entry)\item EFAULT: oldpath or newpath is a NULL pointer.\item ENOTDIR: A component of path prefix is not a directory.\item ECOMM: Communication error\item EPROTONOSUPPORT: oldpath or newpath has a syntax error or the protocol speficied is not supported\item EINVAL: oldpath or newpath has an invalid syntax . \end{itemize}
\end{itemize}
\end{itemize}
